title.narrative: BELA Defending Environmental Rights and Promoting Justice 2019-2022
BELA Försvara miljörättigheter och främja rättvisa 2019-2022

description.narrative: Goal: Protect natural resources, defend peoples’ environmental rights, promote and institutionalize environmental justice. Outcomes: - Institutionalize the concept of ‘environmental justice’ and ‘sustainable development’ by persistently challenging in actions, malpractices and non-compliance's that adversely affect peoples’ right to environment and natural resources. - Strengthen the regulatory framework on environment by pushing for necessary enactments/amendments in the regulatory regime for adhering to the principles of sustainable management and development. - Strengthen environmental governance by enlightening communities on legal rights and duties and by enhancing their participation in environmental decision making. - Enhance capacity of and activate public agencies, private sector actors, civil society and common people on environmental justice issues. - Attain state of the art management standards and capacity development of BELA and the enhancement of skills of staff-members for effective implementation of programmes and financial management.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Bangladesh Environmental Lawyers Association (BELA) har ansökt om finansiering för att utföra insatsen "Försvara miljörättigheter och främja rättvisa" under perioden 2019–2022.
Det övergripande målet med programmet är att skydda naturresurser, försvara människors miljörättigheter samt främja och institutionalisera miljörättvisa. Detta kommer att uppnås genom ett antal åtgärder, inklusive inlämning av nya rättsfall och uppföljning av pågående, kapacitetsuppbyggnad av utsatta människor och samhällen samt andra aktörer, skapandet av en nationell plattform för miljöaktivister, förespråka lagliga förändringar och bredda stödbasen för BELAs aktivism.
Insatsen syftar till att: - Institutionalisera begreppet 'miljörättvisa' och 'hållbar utveckling' genom att ständigt utmana overksamhet, oegentligheter och bristande efterlevnad av lagar som påverkar människors rätt till miljö och naturresurser. - Stärka regelverket för miljö genom att driva på nödvändiga bestämmelser/ändringar i regelverket för att följa principerna om hållbar förvaltning och utveckling. - Stärka miljöförvaltningen genom att upplysa medborgare och samhällen om lagliga rättigheter och skyldigheter och öka deras deltagande i miljöbeslut. - Förbättra kapacitet hos offentliga myndigheter, aktörer inom den privata sektorn, det civila samhället och gemene om rättvisefrågor inom miljö. - Uppnå goda ledningsstandarder och kapacitetsutveckling av BELA samt förstärkning av personalens kompetens för ett effektivt genomförande av program och ekonomisk förvaltning.
Den totala budgeten för insatsen beräknas uppgå till 18 000 000 kronor, varav 1 500 000 kronor kommer att användas för kapacitetstärkande aktiviteter för BELA inom resultatstyrning, jämställdhetsintegrering samt intern kapacitetsutvärdering och utveckling. Ambassaden finansierar 100% av den totala programbudgeten.

Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Bangladesh Environmental Lawyers Association (BELA) has applied for funding to conduct the programme "Defend Environmental Rights and Promote Justice" during the period 2019-2022.
The goal of the programme is to protect natural resources, defend peoples’ environmental rights, promote and institutionalize environmental justice. This will be achieved through a number of actions including filing of new litigations and following up pending ones, capacity building of affected communities and other stakeholders, creating a national platform of environmental activists, advocating for legal changes, and widening the support base of BELA's activism.
The contribution is aiming to: - Institutionalize the concept of ‘environmental justice’ and ‘sustainable development’ by persistently challenging inactions, malpractices and non-compliances that adversely affect peoples’ right to environment and natural resources. - Strenghten the regulatory framework on environment by pushing for necessary enactments/amendments in the regulatory regime for adhering to the principles of sustainable management and development. - Strengthen environmental governance by enlightening communities on legal rights and duties and by enhancing their participation in environmental decision making. - Enhance capacity of and activate public agencies, private sector actors, civil society and common people on environmental justice issues. - Attain state of the art management standards and capacity development of BELA and the enhancement of skills of staff-members for effective implementation of programmes and financial management.
The total budget for the contribution is SEK 18,000,000 of which SEK 1,500,000 will be used for capacity-enhancing activities for BELA within results based management, gender mainstreaming and internal capacity evaluation and development. The Embassy finances 100% of the total programme budget.

description.narrative: Main achievements - two crucial legal victories which serves as benchmarks in the quest of environmental justice in Bangladesh was made in 2020. Firstly, a landmark victory against a powerful business conglomerate that had grabbed nearly 750 acres of farmland and wetlands in Narayanganj, a district next to Dhaka. The court case had been ongoing since 2014 to protect farmers land from being filled with sand. The business changed its venture from a housing project to private economic zone to avoid legal sanctions. The Court finally declared both these ventures illegal and not only directed removal of sand from wetlands and farmers (approximately 400 farmers) lands, but also directed payment of compensation to them. This is the first time that a private economic zone has been declared illegal. The second victory was against a large, illegal brick kiln in Jashore district that was adversely affecting approximately 1500 people. In early November, 2020, the High Court ruled in favour of BELA, ultimately leading to the demolition of the brick kiln in December, 2020. - two new Public Interst Litigations (PILs) have been filed, the first being a case of massive industrial pollution caused by MAAR Ltd., a corn starch company in Habiganj, affecting at least 400,000 people. The second was a petition filed to protect the Ichamoti River from pollution and encroachment, and the eviction of 285 encroachers to restore around 84 kilometres of the river. - eleven petitions have been drafted on a range of issues including protecting 14 142 acres of notified forest land; preventing leasing out of thirty Quarries in Hilly Streams without conducting an objective Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) and without Environment Clearance Certificates (ECC); protecting a large wetland; protecting the Sangu Reserve Forest and its rich biodiversity from indiscriminate tree felling; protecting wildlife; relocating Chemical warehouses from Old Dhaka and to compensate 71 fireaffected families; protecting a pond from unlawful and unauthorized filling up; illegal and unauthorized setting up and hazardous operation of a Board Mill; illegal, unregulated and unauthorized setting up and operation of stone crusher units that seriously threaten the environment, public health, safety, comfort and well-being of surrounding communities; illegal sand mining from riverbeds all over the country and protecting 505 acres of Ratargul Swamp Forest and its biodiversity from any adverse activities. - BELA have also taken a leading role in forming two new strategic alliances. The first is in response to the draft Detailed Area Plan of the government. BELA convened a diverse group of urban planners, architects, academicians and other concerned parties to draft recommendations to be submitted as part of the public hearing. It was decided this alliance would be leveraged into a more concrete platform in 2021. The second is to respond to the crisis around a planned hotel and resort construction in the Chimbuk Hill area of the Bandarbans on the lands of the indigenous Mro community. BELA brought together leading civil society actors including academics, human rights activists, indigenous and NGO leaders in solidarity with the Mro people sent out protest letters to national and international agencies. A press conference was also held urging for an end to the arbitrarily planned construction. The legal victories and the solidarity actions have received wide media coverage and attention the same was also empowered the agitating Mro community. The alliance on Mro issue shall continue for further actions as required. - BELA has engaged with the government in proposing to have two newlaws on forests and clean air, and new set of rules on ship breaking, DraftRiver Protection Commission Act, 2020 and EIA Rules and Public HearingRules. More specifically, BELA has submitted specific proposals for changes in the proposed Forest Act-2019, Clean Air Act 2020, and Ship Recycling Rules 2020. A proposal has also been submitted for enactment of a new law titled the Bangladesh Forest (Conservation) Act, 2020. The recommendations of BELA and other civil society actors have been compiled and have been brought to the attention of the policy and law makers under BELA's leadership. - two studies has been intitiated by BELA, one on the state of the rivers of Bangladesh and the other one on the impact of social forestry on natural forest cover. - on 29 September 2020, the network members of BELA Sylhet organized ahuman chain in Sylhet city to protest hill cutting and to call for the implementation of a 2012 judgment that sought to put an end to theenvironmentally destructive practice. The human chain was attended by about 40 participants (male 38, female 2). - during the reporting period eight beneficiary feedback meetings have beenheld on multiple issues including protection and conservation of wetlands,rivers, forests by BELA Barishal (1), BELA Chattogram (2), BELA Khulna (1), BELA Rajshahi (1), BELA Sylhet (1), and BELA Tangail (2). - eleven community consultations were held in 2020. The different consultations were around the protection of Jhenaidah Park, conservation needs of Laskmi Baor Swamp Forest, consultation with Asbestos Victims, consultation on Industrial Pollution by the Maar Company, consultation on Phultala Water Supply Issue, consultation on Silica Sand Extraction from Hill Canals of Moulavibazar, protection and conservation on Bayezid Bostami Turtles and consultation with the Water Stressed People of Patia. - on 21 June 2020, BELA has been awarded with the prestigious TangFoundation Award for its role in promoting Rule of Law in Bangladesh. Theaward citation states that the award is being given “for the efforts in furthering the rule of law and its institutions through education and advocacy. Utilizing innovative strategic litigation, informed by rigorous scholarship, these organizations have shown exemplary perseverance in promoting greater individual, social and environmental justice, in milieus where the foundations of the rule of law are under severe challenge.”
